algorithm_technique: Greedy approach: Find the two cheapest chocolates and check if they can be bought within the budget.
problem_summary_simple: Buy two cheapest chocolates. Return leftover money, or original money if you can't afford them.
problem_summary_technical: Find the two minimum elements in the prices array and subtract their sum from money if affordable.
key_insights: To minimize cost, always pick the two cheapest chocolates.
The problem can be solved by finding the two smallest elements in the `prices` array.
If the sum of the two cheapest chocolates exceeds `money`, return `money`.
